intro: Corydalis longipes var. chumbica, commonly known as the Chumbi Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of Nepal and Bhutan. It is a member of the Fumariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically range in color from pink to purple. The plant features slender, ascending stems and lanceolate leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in alpine meadows at elevations above 3,000 meters. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
